content: Hi Guys, a reminder that the reviewed documents are starting to be transferred into dropbox folders for your attention. Ping me if you need to get access. You'll find that most documents contain reviews for many committees (because of the way they were generated) - especially true for value sets! Copies will have been placed in all the appropriate folders though (provided I did my job correctly) so just ignore the ones that don't apply to you...
Do we need to add comments in the doc to justify why we are not applying a suggested QA change? For example, https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/STU3-QA/topic/Value.20Set.20Copyright
Nope. QA feedback is just a recommendation. Take it or leave it as you see fit. If someone really wants a change and a formal response to it, they need to use the change request mechanism.

btw - a reminder that any changes should be applied by this coming sunday. A reminder that you only need look at the resources/modules that you have responsibility for in the documents - in many cases one document covered multiple committees, so I copied the doc into each committeee
I also noticed that a number of the changes highlighted were related to formatting in the document rather than the underlying spec. These can be ignored...
I have addressed Imaging, Privacy, and Security -- I will keep monitoring for any updates.
thanks! And a reminder to others that you'll need an invite to the drop box folder where the reviewed documents are. Email me - david.hay@gmail.com or skype david.hay25 with your email...
The reviews are still dribbling in...
CDS and CQI QA are done.
grwat
Patient Care is done as well
If anyone has extra bandwidth over the weekend, FHIR-I has lots :)
I might have some time tomorrow. Can you send me an invite from the site?
Done
Thanks

Hi Guys. I figure this is the best stream to reach out to those who need to apply the QA audits to the spec (Please copy if there is a better option).

As the files are reviewed, I copy them into a dropbox folder that you should all be able to access. Here's a link: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/yz10y5g9ta2gs9d/AADFy6L49UCuFqgKfwWA_3sUa?dl=0

I've organized the filenames so that it should be obvious which committee is responsible for applying changes. The file name patterns are:

  • {typename}-qa - the pages for a single resource. includes the definitions, pages, profiles
  • Terminology_{committee code} - terminology sorted by committee
  • allContentsSection{n} - all content (pages) other than resources. Chopped into 19 sections for ease of reviewing. I'm suspicious that FHIR-I is responsible for these
  • Datatypes-qa - FHIR-I

(note that reviewers often place their initials on the end of the filename)

As you apply the changes, could you rename (or delete) the files so we know they've been actioned? maybe preface them with 'done' - eg done_account-qa...

According to the [wiki] (http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=FHIR_Ballot_Prep) the date to apply starts 25 March, but there shouldn't be any overlap, so feel free to apply any time.

Let me know if there are any questions.

fhirQA2018Reviewed
@David Hay It looks like that dropbox folder is empty when I view it. Have you added the files reviewed?

Oh poo. Try this one: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/x9dumdq44ljvx65/AABteSAyokR6x0Ay0T9R81Mga?dl=0

reviewedFiles

There are changes identified that don't seem to be in the spreadsheets. For example for Medication.ingredient.id and ingredient.extension. Is there a central place that changes should be made (capitalization, etc).
what exactly is the change?

I've attached the qa document. I identified the same changes for other resources.
medication-qa_sc.docx
ok so those changes are proposals to apply QA to the base data types.
Okay...I'll make the other changes
ServiceRequest is missing. Is it not done yet?

@Grahame Grieve I see the same as Melva in my QA document for CommunicationRequest.payload.id (essentially the ask is to update Element.id definition, such that unique is capitalized to Unique as the first word in the definition)
Were extensions included in the QA review? The resource-specific QA documents end with a heading for "Extension Definitions" but nothing follows.

FYI - I have skipped updating displays for codes (questionable whether those are truly non-substantive). That said, I got comments saying that code displays were inconsistent across code systems - sometimes Entered In Error and sometimes Entered in Error. Which is correct?

@David Hay PC has 5 resources that are marked as review completed in the spreadsheet, but I don't see them in the DropBox. Is it safe to assume (or just my wishful thinking) that those resources don't have any changes needed? For example: CarePlan, CareTeam, ClinicalImpression, Communication, and Flag.
@Michelle (Moseman) Miller wishful thinking I'm afraid! A combination of some reviewed items I missd in my email, and ones just arrived from Wes (super-review-hero) Rishel
ah, I asked via email the same question...

The allContent* files are much harder to manage on the 'applied' side. I found security stuff across 12 and 13, but not excusive. So how are we going to handle these fractional portions of the allContent* files?

The problem is that it's not easy to pull out the 'security-related' pages from the build (as far as I can tell), I had assumed that most of the 'all content' files would be FHIR-I responsibility anyway... as they're all non-resource type files...

BTW - if there are files marked as reviewed in the spreadsheet, but not present in the folder them let me know - I may have not copied it across. I think that next time around I'll get reviewers to copy files directly into the folder, and take me out of the loop...
@David Hay ok, thanks for the confirmation that I'm a dreamer :)
For the allContent files, is it better if one person worked on all changes in 1 or more of the files? I'm happy to take a stab at fixing a set of them. Thoughts?
We're all dreamers in one sense or another!
@David Hay I don't see the ii.html file. one Wes would have done

I am working on the activitydefinition-qa-SH doc. I noticed several comments for "Field Code Changed" in the introduction. I am unsure what action to take there if any is required. The activitydefinition-introduction.xml seems to align with the doc.
@John Moehrke - will look into it...
@David Hay FYI - It looks like Condition has now finished review, but I don't see it in the DropBox yet.
sorted...
@Melva Peters - just saw your comment - that sounds like a good idea - just make a start and mark in the 'changes applied' column when done...
(and make a note when starting so others don't pick the same as you)
Hopefully other noble appliers will help out!
(This was about applying changes to the 'allContentOneFile' files - (not that well named in retrospect, you can probably guess the history... )

@David Hay I'll start working through, but I'm not sure how much I'll get done over the course of the day. I'm marking in the Google sheet which ones I'm working on as well as making notes if there are some that have not been applied.
@Melva Peters If you want you can ping me as you run across stuff for me to apply. I'm working on the IPS IG and will also be applying QA throughout the day.

@Rob Hausam if you have time to work on some of the AllContentSection updates. I've started at the top with Section 1 and Section 2. Maybe you can start at the bottom. I've added a column to the spreadsheet "Working on" so you can mark which ones you're working on and then mark them complete when applied.
OK. I'll switch over to that once I get through resolving my remaining IG build errors.
So, is it behaviour or behavior :)
second, I think
yes
where are the updated docs found?
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/x9dumdq44ljvx65/AABteSAyokR6x0Ay0T9R81Mga?dl=0
thx
And there's this spreadsheet to coordinate application of changes
I split the spreadsheet into 3 tabs to make it easier to filter the resources
did you just delete all the status codes?
No
Cut and pasted to separate tabs
I did filter the resources to only show the ones that hadn't been applied
oh. didn't realise your filter applied to me
You can create your own filters that don't impact others, but I figured that one was useful to everyone right now.
